s1.title: About Downloading
s1.p: Using Netscape or Mozilla? If you're using Netscape for downloading, you might want to use the "Save As" feature as prompted via a right click. This is because Netscape thinks it should install jars into itself if left-clicked. Doh!

s1.title: Applications for Jesktop
s1.p: Applications for Jesktop are listed on the www.jesktopapps.sourceforge.net website. There are a couple of applications that come with Jesktop from the Apache site - "Explorer" and some miscellaenous apps.

s1.title: Jesktop API Source

p.strong: If you want to download and compile your own version of Jesktop API

s1.p: A snapshot of the source depot. You'll have to do some file copying and run some build scripts before running Jesktop. Click - zip tar.gz.
For a raw view of the directory (so you can see file sizes) see this.

After downloading and unzipping, all you have to do with this is run the build.bat of build.sh file. After that, go into phoenoix/bin and launch Jesktop with run.bat or run.sh. After that launch "Simple Installer" and install applications from http://www.jesktopapps.sourceforge.net/apps. These are installable remotely, or you can download them (recommended) first.

s1.title: Jars and Interfaces for use with other projects

p.strong: If you are a developer of a GUI app and want to include jars or classes to make it Jesktop compatible.

s1.p: The API for Jesktop contained applications is available here (@jesktop-frimble.jar.size@). This is useful if you are planning to create your own Jesktop compatible applications. For your own development, it is sufficuent for you to include the contained classes you jar.

Three very simple demos that represent complete jesktop compatible applications are here (@jesktop-frimble-demoapp1.jar.size@), here (@jesktop-frimble-demoapp2.jar.size@) and here (@jesktop-frimble-demoapp3.jar.size@). They contain source.

FrimbleDemo demonstrates the use of the abstracted Frame/JinternalFrame Frimble library. FrimbleDemo2 shows an alternative way of doing the same (perhaps simpler). FrimbleDemo3 (in progress) shows an alternative being compatible with JavaWebStart too.

The API for Jesktop's Kernel is available here (@jesktop-api.jar.size@). This is useful if you are planning to create your own Jesktop aware applications. This is a deeper and optional level to that above.
